meanings.definition: To bribe someone more than another person.
meanings.sent1: He outbribed his friend to win the game.
meanings.sent2: She outbribed her competitor to secure the contract.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outbribed the rabbit for the last acorn.
meanings.sent4: The student outbribed his classmates for the teacher's attention.
meanings.sent5: The cat outbribed the dog for the sunny spot by the window.

meanings.definition: To have been bribed more than another person.
meanings.sent1: She felt outbribed when she realized her colleague received a bigger gift.
meanings.sent2: He seemed outbribed by the extravagant offer from the other company.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked outbribed when the dog got two treats instead of one.
meanings.sent4: The tree looked outbribed by the flowers blooming around it.
meanings.sent5: The student felt outbribed when his friend got a better grade without studying.
